numbers on buildings virginia  1522024 dangerous buildings walls or structures a this section is adopted pursuant to the powers vested in the city by  152906 of the virginia as amended any building wall structure or portion thereof that might endanger the public health or safety of other residents of the locality shall be unlawful and shall constitute a nuisance b the director of development and permits director with the concurrence of the city attorney shall have the authority to adopt a policy setting criteria used to determine when a building wall structure or portion thereof hereinafter building qualifies as a dangerous building because it might endanger the public health or safety of other residents of the city the policy shall be based on three criteria 1 habitual city related to the condition or maintenance of the building  2 neglected obsolete and abandoned buildings as defined in the policy  and 3 dangerous conditions or use these criteria shall be used to determine if there is an essential nexus between the dangerous conditions and a legitimate governmental purpose if upon evaluation of the building by the director or designee and the city attorneys office it is determined that declaring the building dangerous is reasonably necessary to the effectuation of a legitimate governmental purpose including without limitation the protection of public health and safety then the director or designee shall give the owner or agent for the owner and any lienholders written notice that the building has been declared dangerous such notice shall be served by registered or certified mail return receipt requested to any lienholders and to the last known address of the property owner such notice shall state with reasonable particularity the defects or other conditions of the building which render it dangerous if applicable the notice shall specify a reasonable period of time within which repairs shall be made or if the building is required to be demolished the notice shall specify a reasonable time within which the demolition must occur the notice shall also advise the owner and lienholders that the director or designee may order the removal of the dangerous building if the owner and lienholders have not repaired or removed same within the stated time given for such action notice mailed to the last known address of the owner and lienholders shall be deemed sufficient under this section an advertisement declaring the building dangerous and stating the time period in which applicable repairs demolition or other corrective action must occur shall be published in a newspaper having general circulation in the city once a week for two successive weeks in addition to the previously listed forms of notification a copy of the notice or advertisement shall also be posted on the dangerous building prior to or simultaneous with the newspaper advertisement if the building poses a significant threat to public safety such notice shall state that finding and also state that the city may take action to prevent unauthorized access to the building within seven days of the date of the notice provided in this subsection in cases in which the building poses a significant threat to public safety the following notice shall be posted at each entrance to such building this building is dangerous and no access is authorized such notice shall remain posted until the building is no longer considered dangerous or is repaired or demolished it shall be unlawful for any person to remove such notice or for any person to enter the posted building without the permission of the director or designee c any owner who has been served with the notice provided for in subsection b shall have 30 days from the date of the notice to appeal the dangerous building determination to the city manager or designee provided that such designee did not participate in making the initial determination to appeal the determination the owner must submit written objections and evidence to show that the building is not dangerous such written objections and evidence must be submitted to the city manager or designee for review if the submissions are deemed sufficient in the reasonable discretion of the city manager or designee then the notice declaring the building dangerous shall be rescinded if the submissions are not deemed sufficient in the reasonable discretion of the city manager or designee then enforcement shall proceed as detailed in this section d in the event that the owner of a building either cannot be found within the time limit stated in the notice provided for in subsection b or if such owner shall fail neglect or refuse to comply with such notice then if all of the other notice requirements of subsection b have been met and the city attorneys office has reviewed the file and signed a written authorization stating that legal requirements contained herein have been met and the city may proceed with demolition then the director or designee or her own agents or employees shall be authorized to order the building to be demolished and the debris removed at the cost of the owner such cost shall include an administrative fee in the amount of $15000 and shall also include the cost of the advertising notice required by subsection b of this section no building shall be demolished by order of the director or designee for at least 30 days following the later of the return of the certified or registered mail receipt sent to the last known address of the owner or the second newspaper publication as provided for in subsection b hereof e all costs and expenses incurred by the city for demolishing a building wall or structure pursuant to the provisions of this section shall be chargeable to and paid by the owner of property and may be collected as real estate taxes and levies are collected any such charges which remain unpaid shall constitute a lien against such property ranking on a parity with liens for unpaid local taxes and enforceable in the same manner as provided in  5813940 et seq and 5813965 et seq of the virginia 195 as amended such liens may be waived by the city treasurer in order to facilitate the sale of the property such liens may be waived only as to a purchaser who is unrelated by blood or marriage to the owner and who has no business association with the owner all such liens shall remain a personal obligation of the owner of the property at the time the liens were imposed f nothing herein shall be construed as limiting the authority of the director or designee human occupancy a pursuant to of the virginia uniform statewide building all unsafe buildings walls or structures and structures unfit for human occupancy are hereby declared illegal and shall be abated by being secured repaired or demolished in accordance with this section such structures shall include those which meet the definitions of unsafe buildings walls or structures or structures unfit for human occupancy as set forth in the virginia uniform statewide building b whenever the code official or designee shall find any building wall or other structure or portion thereof to be unsafe or unfit as defined in this section he or she shall give written notice of such finding by personal delivery to the owner agent or person in control of such building wall or structure and by registered or certified mail to any lienholder having a security interest therein if the notice to the owner agent or person in control of such building is unable to be issued by personal service then the notice shall be sent by registered or certified mail to the last known address of the responsible party and a copy of the notice shall be posted in a conspicuous place on the premises the notice shall list the defects of the building wall or structure and shall require the responsible party within a reasonable and stated time as determined by the particular circumstances either to complete specified repairs or improvements or secure the structure in accordance with the requirements of the virginia uniform statewide building or in the alternative to demolish and remove the building wall or structure or portion thereof the notice shall advise the owner and lienholders that the code official may repair secure or remove the unsafe or unfit building wall or structure if the owner and lienholders have not repaired secured or removed same within the stated time given for such action if necessary such notice shall also require the building structure or portion thereof to be vacated forthwith and not reoccupied until the specified repairs and improvements are completed inspected and approved by the building maintenance official notice served or mailed to the last known address of the owner and lienholders shall be deemed sufficient under this section the code official shall further cause to be posted at each entrance to such building a notice as follows this building is unsafe and its use or occupancy has been prohibited by the building official such notice shall remain posted until the required repairs are made actions to secure are undertaken or demolition is completed it shall be unlawful for any person to remove such notice without permission from the code official or for any person to enter any building or structure so posted except for the purpose of making the required repairs securing or of demolishing the building c the owner agent or person in control of a building wall or structure which has been declared unsafe or unfit shall have the right except in cases of emergency as set forth in subsection e to appeal from the decision of the code official or designee and to appear before the local board of building code appeals at a specified time and place to show cause why he or she should not comply with such notice the written request for appeal must be filed with the board within 14 calendar days of the receipt of the notice served or mailed to the owner under subsection b of this section the appeal procedure shall be governed by the procedures set forth for the local board of building code appeals under the virginia uniform statewide building d in case the owner agent or person in control cannot be found within the time limit stated in the notice provided for in subsection b or if such owner shall fail neglect or refuse to comply with such notice the code official or designee after having ascertained the cost shall cause such building wall structure or portion thereof to remain vacant be secured or be demolished and the debris removed if the code official determines that such building wall structure or portion thereof should be demolished and the debris removed then they shall publish a demolition notice in a newspaper having general circulation in the city once a week for two successive weeks before demolishing said structure said demolition notice shall provide the property address and owner information and state that the city intends to demolish said structure by a stated date any costs associated with the above actions shall be at the expense of the owner as provided in subsection f such cost shall include an administrative fee of $15000 as adopted in city i and shall also include the cost of the demolition notice published in accordance with this subsection e the decision of the code official or designee concerning an unsafe or unfit building wall or structure shall be final in case of an emergency which in the code officials opinion involves imminent danger to human life or health the code official may authorize emergency repairs to unsafe structures or structures unfit for human habitation when it is determined that there is an immediate danger of any portion of the unsafe structure or structure unfit for human habitation collapsing or falling and when life is endangered emergency repairs may also be authorized where there is a code violation resulting in the immediate serious and imminent threat to the life and safety of the occupants the code official shall be permitted to authorize the necessary work to make the structure temporarily safe whether or not legal action to compel compliance has been instituted in addition whenever an owner of an unsafe structure or structure unfit for human habitation fails to comply with the notice provided as required by subsection b of this section in the time period stipulated in the notice which was based on the imminence of the danger the code official may promptly cause such building wall or structure or portion thereof to be made safe secured or demolished in emergency cases no demolition notice must be published in the newspaper as is required in subsection d of this section for the purpose of demolition the code official may at once enter such building or structure or upon the land on which any such building wall or structure stands or abutting land or structures with such assistance and at such cost as the code official may deem necessary the code official may vacate adjacent structures and protect the public by appropriate fences or such other means as he or she may deem necessary and for this purpose may temporarily close a public or private way or request that gas and electric utility services be discontinued to any unsafe or unfit building or structure posing an imminent danger to human life or health f costs and expenses incurred by the city under this section for repairing demolishing or securing an unsafe or unfit building wall or structure shall be charged to the owner of the property involved and shall be collected by the city as taxes and levies are collected every charge with which the owner of such property shall have been assessed and which remains unpaid shall constitute a lien against such property ranking on a parity with liens for unpaid local taxes and enforceable in the same manner as provided in  5813940 et seq and 5813965 et seq of the virginia 195 as amended such liens may be waived by the city treasurer in order to facilitate the sale of the property such liens may be waived only as to a purchaser who is unrelated by blood or marriage to the owner and who has no business association with the owner all such liens shall remain a personal obligation of the owner of the property at the time the liens were imposed g notwithstanding the provisions of this section the city may proceed under the authority vested in city  152906 of the virginia or the city may proceed to abate or remove a public nuisance under  152900 et seq of the virginia in addition the city may exercise any other remedies available under general and special law h any owner agent or person in control of an unsafe or unfit building wall or other structure who fails to section 1434 of this d violations and penalties 1 criminal penalties  continuing violations it shall be unlawful for any owner or any other person firm or corporation to violate any provisions of the code adopted in this section any such violation shall be punishable as a class 1 misdemeanor in addition each day the violation continues after conviction or the courtordered abatement period has expired shall constitute a separate offense if the violation remains uncorrected at the time of the conviction the court shall order the violator to abate or remedy the violation in order to comply with the code except as otherwise provided by the court for good cause shown any such violator shall abate or remedy the violation within six months of the date of conviction each day during which the violation continues after the courtordered abatement period has ended shall constitute a separate offense any person convicted of a second offense involving the same property committed within ten years of an offense under this section shall be punished by a fine of not less than $50000 any person convicted of a third or subsequent offense involving the same property committed within ten years of an offense under this section after having been at least twice previously convicted shall be punished by confinement in jail for not more than ten days and a fine of not less than $100000 2 civil penalties in lieu of criminal prosecution as authorized in subsection 1 of this section there are hereby established civil penalties for violation of the virginia uniform statewide building are not abated or remedied promptly after receipt of notice of violation or notice to comply from the department of development and permits upon failure to abate or remedy pursuant to a notice the department of development and permits may issue a civil summons or ticket to any person in violation of any provision of the virginia uniform statewide building in noncompliance with the requirements thereof or the requirements of this section in accordance with the uniform schedule of civil penalties set forth below each day during which the violation is found to have existed shall constitute a separate offense however the specified violations arising from the same operative set of facts shall not be charged more frequently than once in any tenday period and a series of specified violations arising from the same operative set of facts shall not result in civil penalties which exceed a total of $400000 designation of a particular building code violation pursuant to this subsection shall be in lieu of criminal sanctions and shall preclude prosecution of the violation as a misdemeanor except for any violation that results in injury to persons a the uniform civil penalties adopted for all violations of the virginia uniform statewide building this section shall be $10000 for a first offense and $15000 for the second and each subsequent offense the summons shall be issued on summons forms or tickets approved by the general district court of the city court and may be personally served on the person or entity charged by the department of development and permits service of the summons may also be accomplished by certified mail return receipt requested to the last known address of the person or entity charged or by any other method of service permitted by law b the summons or ticket shall provide that the person or entity summonsed for a violation of this article may elect to pay the civil penalty by making an appearance in person or in writing by mail to the city treasurer or designee at least 72 hours prior to the time and date fixed for trial and by such appearance may enter a waiver of trial admit liability and pay the civil penalty established for the offense such summons or ticket shall also provide that a signature to an admission of liability shall have the same force and effect as a judgment of the court  however an admission shall not be deemed a criminal confession for any purpose if a person or entity charged with a violation does not elect to enter a waiver of trial and admit liability the violation shall be tried in the same manner and with the same right of appeal as other civil matters heard by the court a finding of liability shall not be deemed a criminal conviction for any purpose c if the violation concerns a residential unit and if the violation remains uncorrected at the time of assessment of the civil penalty the court shall order the violator to abate or remedy the violation in order to comply with the virginia uniform statewide building as otherwise provided by the court for good cause shown any such violator shall abate or remedy the violation within six months of the date of the assessment of the civil penalty 3 other remedies nothing herein shall preclude the director of development or permits or designee from pursuing other available remedies such as injunctive relief to correct a continuing or frequent violation of this article             o157  131 111092  o189 92794  o130 101497  o109 112701  o140 102803  o098 62204  o097 81109  o134 11910 inspections of elevators dumbwaiters etc the foot of the finished floor of the pool b all public spas and hot tubs shall be designed and constructed of such shape and contour that efficient and safe control of the bathers can be accomplished the a public swimming pool if a recessed type of gutter located near the top of the walls is to be used the gutter shall have a minimum depth of three inches and shall be of a design which will permit satisfactory cleaning of the overflow channel the gutter drain outlets shall be spaced around the pool not more than 15 feet on centers the gutter bottom shall slope toward these outlets with a minimum slope of oneeighth inch to the foot the drains shall not be less than two and onehalf inches in diameter and the total orifice area of the grating shall be at least twice the cross sectional area of the outlet pipe b for the pools with overflow gutters a water level control tank shall be provided which will effectively provide for maintenance of the water level to produce surface skimming action at all times c in lieu of overflow gutters skimming devices can be provided there shall be at least one skimming device for each 400 square feet of pool surface or fraction thereof skimmers shall be designed for a flowof at least 30 gallons per minute and all skimmers in the pool shall be capable of handling approximately 80 percent of the required filter flow of the recirculation system the overflow weir shall be of sufficient length to maintain a rate of flow of at least 20 gallons per minute per linear foot of weir lip an equalizer line shall be provided at least one foot below the overflow level of the skimmer to prevent airlock in the suction line if the pool level should drop below the weir level on hot tubs or spas when surface skimmers are used as the sole overflow system one surface skimmer should be provided for each 100 square feet 93 square meters or fraction thereof of the whirlpool or hot tub surface area when two or more skimmers are used they should be located to maintain effective skimming action over the entire surface area of the whirlpool or hot tub d if the recirculation system is designed for water to enter the bottom portion of the pool and overflow the top adequate drainage of the scum and floating material from the deck must be provided this may be by a continuous drain or multiple drains in multiple drains each drain grating shall have a total orifice area of at least four times the cross sectional area of the drainpipe which shall have a minimum diameter of two and onehalf inches in the use of drain channels continuous around the perimeter of the pool the channel grating shall be designed so as not to create a hazard to fingers and toes and shall be resistant to corrosion o047 42605 inlets where inlets are in pool walls such inlets with a covered receptacle for sanitary napkins o047 42605  o013 21406  o097 81109 secs 1417714185  reserved division 3  standards for recirculation system and appurtenances recirculation systems  filter rooms a all swimming pools shall be equipped with a recirculation system consisting of pumps hair and lint catchers filters disinfection equipment and necessary pipe connections to the inlets and outlets adequate provisions shall be made for backwashing filters b public pools spashot tubs and wading pools shall have maximum turnover rates as follows public pools six hours public spashot tubs thirty minutes wading pools one hour c filter room public pools shall be provided with a structure or room to contain the filtration equipment pumps and other recirculation system appurtenances and disinfection equipment the room shall be finished in a light color and be constructed of materials which are impervious to water and chemicals necessary for the operation of the pool adequate illumination of 20 footcandles measured 24 inches 61 centimeters above floor level shall be provided by national electric nec approved vaporproof lighting fixtures the floor of the filter room shall be designed to provide for an adequate drainage with a minimum floor slope of  and a maximum of  to the drain and shall be kept dry particularly in the vicinity of electrical panels all enclosures shall be located at or above ground level the enclosure shall be provided with ducts from the bottom of the enclosure to the atmosphere in an unrestricted area a motordriven exhaust fan capable of producing at least one air change per minute and louvers of good design near the top of the enclosure for admitting fresh air warning signs shall be posted on the doors doors to the chlorine room shall open away from the pool electrical switches for control of artificial lighting and ventilation shall be on the outside of the enclosure adjacent to the door the provision of any facility for discharging filter backwashing water into the filter room floor is prohibited the room shall be provided with a door or doors of sufficient width to permit the removal of equipment and shall be capable of being secured against entry by unauthorized persons the entrance to the filter room shall be adjacent to the pool area or so located that the operator can enter the room without having to exit the enclosed pool area protective clothing ie respirators facemasks rubber gloves and aprons or coveralls shall be provided for personnel handling chlorine chemical compounds and other caustic chemicals respirators approved by the national institute for occupational safety and health niosh shall be provided for protection against chlorine at least one approved selfcontained breathing apparatus shall be provided respiratory equipment shall be mounted outside the chlorine enclosure training and maintenance programs for respirators shall be provided in accordance with occupational safety and health administration osha requirements d filters the recirculation system shall be equipped with a filtration system that will filter the entire contents of the pool at the required rate filtration equipment shall be operated continuously 24 hours per day design criteria for the indicated type of filters shall be as follows 1 rapid sand filter a filter utilizing sand as the filter media with filtration flow rate not exceeding three gallons per minute per square foot 122 liters per minute per square meter of filter area the backwash rate of flow shall be three times the filtration rate 2 anthracite filter a filter utilizing anthracite as a filter media with filtration flow rate not exceeding three gallons per minute per square foot 122 liters per minute per square meter of filter area the backwash rate of flow shall be three times the filtration rate 3 high rate filter a filter utilizing a media capable of filtration at a high rate of flow the rate of flow shall be greater than five gallons per minute per square foot 2037 liters per minute per square meter of filter area the backwash rate of flow shall be the same as filtration rate 4 diatomaceous earth filter a filter utilizing diatomaceous earth as a filter media there are two types of these filters a pressure or vacuumtype a diatomaceous earth filter the rate of flow does note exceed two gallons per minute per square foot 815 liter per minute per square meter b pressure or vacuumtype with slurry feeder a filter equipped to continuously feed a diatomaceous earth suspension and having a rate of flow not to exceed three gallons per minute per square foot 122 liters per minute per square meter a backwash sump pit with a stand pipe shall be installed to collect spent diatomaceous earth so that it can be collected and disposed of with solid waste any other method for accomplishing this may be submitted for consideration other filtration systems which are equal to or better than those described above may be used in a pool recirculation system with the approval of the director of public health e gauges gauges shall be installed as required on all filter systems to readily indicate the operating pressures of recirculating systems all gauges shall measure pressure directly in pounds per square inch or kilograms per square meter and shall have an indicator at least two inches 508 centimeters in diameter f rate of flow indicators the recirculating system shall be equipped with a rate of flow indicator which has been approved by the director of public health the indicator shall read in gallons per minute or liters per minute and shall be located to indicate the rate of flow of filtered water being returned to the pool the indicator shall be of fixed calibration and properly sized so as to indicate the designed rate of flow at approximately midscale g hair and lint strainer at all installations where it is possible for water from the pool to pass filters a strainer shall be provided on the suction side of the pump to prevent hair lint and other matter from reaching the pump and filters strainers shall be corrosionresistant with openings not over oneeighthinch in size providing a free flow area at least four times the area of the pump suction line at the strainer connection and shall be accessible for frequent cleaning o047 42605 piping systems a the piping system recirculating the pool water treatment equipment  4 backwashing to waste  5 operating suction cleaner  6 emptying the pool  and 7 draining the system b there shall be no direct connections between the pool recirculating system and the sewer or the potable water supply fill spouts may be located under diving boards under guard chairs or adjacent to pool ladder handrails fill spouts shall be installed a minimum of two inches 508 centimeters above the coping or submersed fill spouts shall be equipped with a backflow preventer c waste from backwashing shall be discharged in a manner valve backwash  black influent  yellow effluent  white vacuum  orange if labeling is used as an option labels and arrows of flows shall be spaced every three feet labeling shall be two inches in height e all piping shall be designed to reduce friction losses to a minimum and to carry the required quantity of water at a maximum velocity not to exceed ten feet per second 305 meters per second upon the persons firms and corporations engaged therein within this locality o179 111996 definitions for the purposes of this chapter unless otherwise required by the context acquisition as used in the definition of qualifying business shall mean the combination of two or more existing businesses where one business acquires the ownership of the other businesses affiliated group means 1 one or more chains of corporations subject to inclusion connected ownership with a common parent corporation which is a corporation subject to inclusion if a stock possessing at least 80 percent of the voting power of all classes of stock and at least 80 percent of each class of the nonvoting stock of each of the corporations subject to inclusion except the common parent corporation is owned directly by one or more of the other corporations subject to inclusion  and b the common parent corporation directly owns stock possessing at least 80 percent of the voting power of all classes of stock and at least 80 percent of each class of the nonvoting stock of at least one of the other corporations as used in this subdivision the term stock does not include nonvoting stock which is limited and preferred as to dividends the term includable corporation or phrase corporation subject to inclusion means any corporation within the affiliated group irrespective of the state or country of its incorporation  and the term receipts includes gross receipts and gross income 2 two or more corporations if five or fewer persons who are individuals estates or trusts own stock possessing a at least 80 percent of the total combined voting power of all classes of stock entitled to vote or at least 80 percent of the total value of shares of all classes of the stock of each corporation  and b more than 50 percent of the total combined voting power of all classes of stock entitled to vote or more than 50 percent of the total value of shares of all classes of stock of each corporation taking into account the stock ownership of each such person only to the extent such stock ownership is identical with respect to each such corporation when one or more of the corporations subject to inclusion including the common parent corporation is a nonstock corporation the term stock as used in this chapter shall refer to the nonstock corporation membership or membership voting rights as is appropriate to the context 3 two or more entities if such entities satisfy the requirements in paragraphs 1 or 2 of this definition as if they were corporations and the ownership interests therein were stock amusement operator means any person who sells leases rents or otherwise furnishes or provides a coinoperated amusement machine in the city however a person shall be excepted from this definition if such person 1 owns fewer than three such machines  and 2 operates such machines on property owned or leased by such person assessment means a determination as to the proper rate of tax the measure to which the tax rate is applied and ultimately the amount of tax including additional or omitted tax that is due an assessment shall include a written assessment made pursuant to notice by the assessing official or a selfassessment made by a taxpayer upon the filing of a return or otherwise not pursuant to notice assessments shall be deemed made by an assessing official when a written notice of assessment is delivered to the taxpayer by the assessing official or an employee of the assessing official or mailed to the taxpayer at his last known address selfassessments shall be deemed made when a return is filed or if no return is required when the tax is paid a return filed or tax paid before the last day prescribed by this chapter for the filing or payment thereof shall be deemed to be filed or paid on the last day specified for the filing of a return or the payment of tax as the case may be assessor or assessing official means the commissioner of the revenue for the city of chesapeake base year means the calendar year preceding the license year except for contractors subject to the provisions of virginia  5813715 business means a course of dealing which requires the time attention and labor of the person so engaged for the purpose of earning a livelihood or profit the term implies a continuous and regular course of dealing rather than an irregular or isolated transaction a person may be engaged in more than one business the following acts shall create a rebuttable presumption that a person is engaged in a business 1 advertising or otherwise holding oneself out to the public as being engaged in a particular business  or 2 filing tax returns schedules and documents that are required only of persons engaged in a trade or business business license year not recognized by state corporation commission a change in business form shall include a new business entity that meets the definition of affiliated group as that term is defined in this section and such business conducts activities that are similar to one or more of the affiliated businesses however a new business entity that meets the definition of affiliated group but undertakes a business that conducts substantially different business activities shall not be treated as a change in business form commission merchant means any person engaged in the business of selling merchandise on continuous course of dealing for 30 consecutive days or more a definite place of business for a person engaged in business may include a location leased or otherwise obtained from another person on a temporary or seasonal basis as well as real property leased to another a persons residence shall be deemed to be a definite place of business if there is no definite place of business maintained elsewhere and the person is not licensable as a peddler or itinerant merchant direct seller means any person who 1 engages in the trade or business of selling or soliciting the sale of consumer products primarily in private residences and maintains no public location for the conduct of such business  and 2 receives remuneration for such activities with substantially all of such remuneration being directly related to sales or other salesoriented services rather than to the number of hours worked  and 3 performs such services pursuant to a written contract between such person and the person for whom the activities are performed and such contract provides that such person will not be treated as an employee with respect to such activities for federal tax purposes entity means a business organization other than a sole proprietorship that is a corporation limited liability company limited partnership or limited liability partnership duly organized under the laws of the commonwealth or another state financial services shall mean the buying selling handling managing investing and providing of advice regarding money credit securities and other investments the term shall include compensation by a credit agency excluding credit unions an investment company a broker or dealer in securities and commodities or a security or commodity exchange unless such service is specifically provided for under another section of this chapter 1 broker shall mean an agent of a buyer or a seller who buys or sells stocks bonds commodities or services usually on a commission basis 2 commodity shall mean staples such as wool cotton etc which are traded on a commodity exchange and on which there is trading in futures 3 dealer for purposes of this chapter shall mean any person engaged in the business of buying and selling securities for his own account but does not include a bank or any person insofar as he buys or sells securities for his own account either individually or in some fiduciary capacity but not as part of a regular business 4 security for purposes of this chapter shall have the same meaning as in the securities act set out in virginia  131501 et seq or in similar laws of the united states regulating the sale of securities fuel sale or fuel sales shall mean retail sales of alternative fuel blended fuel diesel fuel gasohol or gasoline as such terms are are defined in the virginia  5812201 as amended gross receipts means the whole entire total receipts attributable to the licensed privilege without deduction except as may be limited by the provisions generally  12 license requirement a every person engaging in the city in any business trade profession occupation or calling collectively hereinafter a business as defined in this chapter unless otherwise exempted by law shall apply for a license for each such business if 1 the person maintains a definite place of business in the city  2 the person does not maintain a definite place of business anywhere but does maintain an abode in the city which abode for the purposes of this chapter shall be deemed a definite place of business  or 3 the person does not maintain a definite place of business in the city but operates amusement machines  or is classified as a peddler itinerant merchant carnival circus or photographer as defined in virginia  5813717 371 372 or 3727 respectively  is a contractor subject to virginia  5813715  or is a public service corporation a license shall be required of all amusement operators peddlers itinerant merchants carnivals circuses photographers contractors and public service corporations rendering licensable services in the city even if the business does not maintain an office or definite place of business in the city or the state b a separate license shall be required for each definite place of business a person engaged in two or more businesses or professions carried on at the same place of business may elect to obtain one license for all such businesses and professions if all of the following criteria are satisfied 1 each business or profession is licensable at the location and has satisfied all requirements imposed by state law or other provisions of the ordinances of this city  2 all of the businesses or professions are subject to the same tax rate or if subject to different tax rates the licensee agrees to be taxed on all businesses and professions at the highest rate  and 3 the taxpayer agrees to supply such information as the assessor may require concerning the nature of the several businesses and their gross receipts c for each license year there is hereby levied an annual license fee or annual license tax to be assessed on each licensable business activity in amounts set forth in this chapter on all persons required to obtain a license to conduct or engage in a business in the city other than a qualifying business exempt from license taxes pursuant to subsection e below d each person required to pay one or more license fees or taxes shall apply to the assessing official for and obtain a license prior to beginning business in the city any person who has been issued a license for the preceding license year shall make application no later than march 1 of the current tax year the application shall be made under oath on written forms provided by the assessing official the application shall contain such information as the assessing official requires including but not limited to the applicants correct name and trade name type and location of the business activity and a recording of actual or estimated gross receipts or gross purchases whichever is applicable e for purposes of this chapter license tax shall be calculated as follows 1 new businesses for the purposes of ascertaining the tax to be paid by any person beginning a new business trade profession or occupation in the city other than a qualifying business as defined in of this whose license tax shall be based on gross receipts gross sales gross purchases gross commissions gross contracts or orders the licensee shall estimate the basis for measuring the license tax between the date of issuance of the license and december 31 following 2 businesses licensed less than full year the license tax of every person who was licensed for only a part of the previous license year other than a qualifying business as defined in of this shall be computed for the current license year on the basis of an estimate of the amount of gross receipts gross sales gross purchases or gross commissions as may be applicable which the licensee will make throughout the current license year 3 established businesses the license tax of every person who was licensed for the previous license year other than a qualifying business as defined in of this has been engaged in a continuous course of business during any portion of two consecutive business years or less shall be computed for the current license year on the amount of gross receipts gross sales gross purchases or gross commissions as may be applicable which the licensee earned in the base year 4 qualifying businesses a tax reduction no license tax shall be assessed or levied on the gross receipts earned or gross purchases made by a qualifying business during each of the first two business license years in which such qualifying business is located in the city this license tax reduction shall apply to the business license year in which the qualifying business first locates in chesapeake and the following business license year b application in order to receive the exemption a qualifying business shall file with the assessing official a business license application and supporting documentation sufficient to establish that the business i has newly located at a definite place of business in the city and ii has engaged in a continuous and regular course of trade from said definite place of business for no longer than two consecutive business license years in the event the assessing official requires additional information to determine whether a business is entitled to an exemption from license tax the qualifying business shall provide such additional documentation in a timely manner c approval of application upon approval of an application the qualifying business shall acquire an annual business license but shall be exempt from the license tax on the gross receipts earned or gross purchases made during the first two business license years the qualifying business is located in chesapeake a qualifying business shall be subject to the $5000 annual license fee for each separate line of business a qualifying business shall report its personal property gross receipts and excise taxes to the assessing official at such times and in such manner as required by law d expiration upon expiration of the initial two business license years the qualifying business shall file a business license return with the assessing official reporting gross receipts gross sales gross purchases or gross commissions as may be applicable earned by the qualifying business in the previous full calendar year the qualifying business shall also submit with the business license return the amount of license tax due after the initial two business license years the qualifying business designation shall automatically lapse and the business shall be considered an established business e forfeiture a qualifying business shall automatically forfeit any entitlement to the business license tax reduction provided herein if i such business is delinquent on any local tax or fee including but not limited to business license fees and tax personal property tax real property tax admissions tax food and beverage tax sales and use tax shortterm rental tax and transient occupancy tax  or ii such business fails to file returns for selfreported taxes at such times and in such manner as required by law f construction of ordinance the business license tax reduction provided for qualifying businesses shall be deemed a partial tax exemption as such this ordinance shall be construed strictly against the taxpayer this ordinance shall not be construed to repeal any requirement for qualifying businesses to maintain records comply with audits or follow any other applicable requirements of this chapter 5 adjustment of estimated tax computations every underestimate of tax liability made under this section shall be subject to correction by the assessing official whose duty it shall be to assess such license with such additional taxes as may be found to be due after the close of the license year on the basis of gross receipts gross sales gross purchases or gross commissions in case of overestimate the assessing official may cause the amount owed to be refunded to the taxpayer or may credit next years license with the amount of overpayment no interest shall accrue on an adjustment of estimated tax liability to actual liability at the end of the tax year f the license fee or tax shall be paid to the city treasurer at the time the application is made for a business license if the tax is measured by the gross receipts or purchases of the business the tax shall be paid on or before march 1 of each year no person may obtain a license until such time that the city treasurer certifies that the applicant or other person of whom a license is required has produced satisfactory evidence that all delinquent business license taxes business personal property taxes machinery and tool taxes admission taxes food and beverages taxes and transient occupancy taxes which have been properly assessed upon the applicant have been paid this provision shall not apply to delinquent taxes penalties or interest that are the subject of a bona fide appeal or application for correction as provided in  5813995 of the virginia 195 as amended g the assessing official may grant an extension of time not to exceed 90 days in which to file an application for a license for reasonable cause the extension shall be conditioned upon the timely payment of a reasonable estimate of the appropriate fee or tax as applicable subject to adjustment to the correct fee or tax at the end of the extension together with interest from the due date until the date paid and if the estimate submitted with the extension is found to be unreasonable under the circumstances a penalty of ten percent of the portion paid after the due date h if any person fails to pay any license fee or tax required under this chapter as a prerequisite to the issuance of a business license or makes payment of such fee or tax by a check which is subsequently dishonored due to insufficient funds or other reason any business license issued to such person shall be null and void and such person shall be liable for all criminal and civil liabilities imposed under this chapter for operating a business without a license i if the activity involved is one for which a license can be granted only on the certificate of a court or other officer or is one for which a separate license permit or certificate is required by any local state or federal government agency or entity before such activity may be conducted then the issuance of a business license under this chapter shall not authorize the conduct of such activity in this city until such certification permit or other license shall be obtained where the place of business trade profession or occupation designated in any persons license is located in an area where the licensed activity is not authorized under the city zoning ordinance such license shall be invalid j if a person fails or refuses to file the required application and information with the assessing official the assessor shall assess the applicable license fee or tax based upon the best information available adding to the fee or tax the penalty and interest prescribed by law o179 111996    o106 71498  o115 81004  o091 81611 penalty and interest a a penalty of ten percent of the tax or $1000 whichever is greater shall be imposed upon the failure to file an application or the failure to pay the tax by the appropriate due date all penalties assessed for the failure to file a license application or the failure to pay the license tax by the appropriate due date shall become part of the tax only the late filing penalty shall be imposed by the assessing official if both the application and payment of tax are late  however both such penalties may be assessed if the assessing official determines that the taxpayer has a history of noncompliance 1 in addition to penalties for failure to file an application or failure to pay the license tax in a timely manner a penalty of $1000 shall also be imposed upon the failure to pay the license fee by the appropriate due date 2 in the case of an assessment of additional or omitted tax made by the assessing official if the application and return were made in good faith and the understatement of the tax was not due to any fraud reckless or intentional disregard of the law by the taxpayer there shall be no late payment penalty assessed with the additional or omitted tax if any assessment of tax by the assessing official is not paid within 30 days the city treasurer shall impose a ten percent late payment penalty or $1000 whichever is greater 3 the penalties provided for herein shall not be imposed or if imposed shall be abated by the official who assessed them if the failure to file or pay was not the fault of the taxpayer in order to demonstrate lack of fault the taxpayer must show that he or she acted responsibly and that the failure was due to events beyond his or her control 4 acted responsibly means that a the taxpayer exercised the level of reasonable care that a prudent person would exercise under the circumstances in determining the filing obligations for the business  and b the taxpayer undertook significant steps to avoid or mitigate the failure such as requesting appropriate extensions where applicable attempting to prevent a foreseeable impediment acting to remove an impediment once it occurred and promptly rectifying a failure once the impediment was removed or the failure discovered c events beyond the taxpayers control include but are not limited to the unavailability of records due to fire or other casualty  the unavoidable absence eg due to death or serious illness of a person with the sole responsibility for tax compliance  or the taxpayers reasonable reliance in good faith upon erroneous written information from the assessing official who was aware of the relevant facts relating to the taxpayers business when the erroneous information was provided b interest shall be charged on the late payment of license tax and license fees at a rate of ten percent per annum from the due date until the date paid without regard to fault or other reason for the late payment interest shall be charged on omitted or additional tax and fees at a rate of ten percent per annum in accordance with virginia  5813903 where the delinquency in any tax or fee extends beyond one year interest shall accumulate on such sums owed at ten percent per annum or at a rate equal to the rate of interest established pursuant to of the internal revenue as amended whichever is greater c whenever an assessment of additional or omitted tax by the assessing official is found to be erroneous all interest and penalty charged and collected on the amount of the assessment found to be erroneous shall be refunded together with interest on the refund from the date of payment or the due date whichever is later in addition interest shall be paid on the refund of any tax paid under this chapter from the date of payment or due date whichever is later whether attributable to an amended return or other reason interest on any refund shall be paid at the same rate charged taxpayers under subsection b above  provided that however no application for a refund will be considered complete until the licensee has provided a full accounting of revenues and all other relevant information requested by the assessing official interest will not accrue on refunds during any time period within which the assessing officer cannot act on a refund request due to the taxpayers failure to provide a full accounting of revenues or other relevant information the city may elect to remit refunds and interest thereon in the ensuing fiscal year and may after written notice to the licensee credit the amount of refund and interest due to the taxpayer to delinquent business license tax owed to the city or to the next ensuing tax year interest on the refund will stop accruing as of the date the notice of credit is mailed to the taxpayer d no interest shall accrue on an adjustment of estimated tax liability to actual liability at the conclusion of a base year no interest shall be paid on a refund or charged on a late payment provided that the refund or the late payment is made not more than 30 days from the date of the payment that created the refund or the due date of the tax whichever is later e the provisions of this section relating to penalty and interest shall be applicable to assessments made on or after  even if for an earlier year o179 111996 proration of taxes upon cessation of business  refunds a proration in the event a person permanently ceases to engage in a business within the city during a year for which a license tax has been paid the taxpayer upon written application to the assessing office shall be entitled to a refund for that portion of the tax paid prorated on a monthly basis so as to ensure that the licensed business is taxed only for that fraction of the year during which it is conducted within the city in addition upon learning that a taxpayer has ceased doing business in the city the assessing officer may initiate a refund of tax even though the taxpayer has not requested same in any case the assessing officer may withhold a refund until such time that the taxpayer has provided to the assessing officer a full accounting of revenues and related matters as deemed necessary by the assessing officer to establish the amount of refund if any due to the taxpayer no application for a refund of tax arising out of the cessation of business activities shall be considered complete until all relevant records requested by the assessing office have been produced for inspection to the extent that state law requires interest to be paid on tax refunds arising out of the cessation of business activities no such interest shall accrue during any period of time within which the assessing officer cannot act on the refund due to the taxpayers failure to provide a full accounting of revenues and other relevant materials requested by the assessing officer the city may elect to remit funds in the ensuing fiscal year or to credit the amount of the refund due to a taxpayer to any amount of delinquent taxes owed by the taxpayer to the city to the extent that state law requires interest to be paid on such refund the interest may also be remitted in the ensuing fiscal year or credited to delinquent taxes owed by the taxpayer to the city such interest shall stop accruing as of the date written notice of credit is mailed to the taxpayer in no event shall the city be required to prorate any fee or minimum flat tax assessed under this chapter b refunds by treasurer the city treasurer is hereby authorized to approve and issue refunds of license tax fees and interest owing to taxpayers due to an erroneous or incorrect assessment provided that the assessing officer certifies the amount of refund due the taxpayer and further provided that the amount of the refund including interest does not exceed $250000 per business license any refund in excess of $250000 per business license shall be presented to the city council for approval in accordance with virginia  5813981 o179 111996  o013 12798 situs of gross receipts a general rule whenever the tax imposed by this chapter is measured by gross receipts the gross receipts included in the taxable measure shall be only those gross receipts attributed to the exercise of a licensable privilege at a definite place of business within the city in the case of activities conducted outside of a definite place of business such as during a visit to a customer location the gross receipts shall be attributed to the definite place of business from which such activities are initiated directed or controlled the situs of gross receipts for different classifications of business shall be attributed to one or more definite places of business or offices as follows 1 the gross receipts of a contractor shall be attributed to the definite place of business at which services are performed or if services are not performed at any definite place of business then the definite place of business from which services are directed or controlled unless the contractor is subject to the provisions of virginia  5813715 2 the gross receipts of a retailer and gross purchases of a wholesaler shall be attributed to the definite place of business at which sales are made or sales solicitation activities occur or if sales or sales solicitation activities do not occur at any definite place of business then the definite place of business from which sales are made or sales solicitation activities are directed or controlled  however a wholesaler or distribution house subject to a license tax measured by gross purchases shall determine the situs of its purchases by the definite place of business at which or from which deliveries of the purchased goods wares and merchandise are made to customers any wholesaler which is subject to license tax in two or more localities and which is subject to multiple taxation because the localities use different measures may apply to the department of taxation for a determination as to the proper measure of purchases and gross receipts subject to license tax in each locality 3 the gross receipts of a business renting tangible personal property shall be attributed to the definite place of business from which the tangible personal property is rented or if the property is not rented from any definite place of business then the definite place of business at which the rental of such property is managed 4 the gross receipts from the performance of personal services shall be attributed to the definite place of business at which the services are performed or if not performed at any definite place of business then the definite place of business from which the services are directed or controlled b apportionment if the licensee has more than one definite place of business and it is impractical or impossible to determine to which definite place of business gross receipts should be attributed under the general rule the gross receipts of the business shall be apportioned between the definite places of businesses as provided in virginia  5813709 gross receipts shall not be apportioned to a definite place of business unless some activities under the applicable general rule occurred at or were controlled from such definite place of business gross receipts attributable to a definite place of business in another jurisdiction shall not be attributed to the city solely because the other jurisdiction does not impose a tax on the gross receipts attributable to the definite place of business in such other jurisdiction c agreements the assessing official may enter into agreements with any other political subdivision of the state concerning the manner in which gross receipts shall be apportioned among definite places of business however the sum of the gross receipts apportioned by the agreement shall not exceed the total gross receipts attributable to all of the definite places of business affected by the agreement upon being notified by a taxpayer that the citys method of attributing gross receipts is fundamentally inconsistent with the method of one or more political subdivisions in which the taxpayer is licensed to engage in business and that the difference has or is likely to result in taxes on more than 100 percent of its gross receipts from all locations in the affected jurisdictions the assessing official shall make a good faith effort to reach an apportionment agreement with the other political subdivisions involved if an agreement cannot be reached either the assessor or the taxpayer may seek an advisory opinion from the department of taxation pursuant to virginia  5813701 notice of the request shall be given to the other party notwithstanding the provisions of virginia  5813993 when a taxpayer has demonstrated to a court that two or more political subdivisions of the state have assessed taxes on gross receipts that may create a double assessment within the meaning of virginia  5813986 the court shall enter such orders pending resolution of the litigation as may be necessary to ensure that the taxpayer is not required to pay multiple assessments even though it is not then known which assessments are correct o179 111996 limitations and extensions a where before the expiration of the time prescribed for the assessment of any license tax imposed pursuant to this chapter correction of the assessment the application must be filed in good faith and sufficiently identify the taxpayer the tax periods covered by the challenged assessment the amount in dispute the remedy sought each alleged error in the assessment the grounds upon which the taxpayer relies and any other facts relevant to the taxpayers contention the assessing official may hold a conference with the determination of the applications the assessment shall be deemed prima facie correct the assessing official shall undertake a full review of the taxpayers claims and issue a written determination to 111996 exclusions and deductions from gross receipts a general rule gross receipts for license tax purposes shall not include any amount not derived from the exercise of the licensed privilege to engage in a business or profession in the ordinary course of business or profession b the following items shall be excluded from gross receipts 1 amounts received and paid to the united states the commonwealth or any county city or town for the state retail sales or use tax or for any local sales tax or any local excise tax on cigarettes for any federal or state excise taxes on motor fuels  2 any amount representing the liquidation of a debt or conversion of another asset to the extent that the amount is attributable to a transaction previously taxed eg the factoring of accounts receivable created by sales which have been included in taxable receipts even though the creation of such debt and factoring are a regular part of its business  3 any amount representing returns and allowances granted by the business to its customer  4 receipts which are the proceeds of a loan transaction in which the licensee is the obligor or borrower  5 receipts representing the return of principal of a loan transaction in which the licensee is the creditor other than a purchase money loan or revolving credit loan where the sale of any merchandise purchased has not been previously reported to the assessing officer or the return of principal or basis upon the sale of a capital asset  6 rebates and discounts taken or received on account of purchases by the licensee a rebate or other incentive offered to induce the recipient to purchase certain goods or services from a person other than the offeror or which the recipient assigns to the licensee in consideration of the sale of goods and services shall not be considered a rebate or discount to the licensee but shall be included in the licensees gross receipts together with any handling or other fees related to the incentive  7 withdrawals from inventory for purposes other than sale or distribution and for which no consideration is received  and the occasional sale or exchange of assets other than inventory whether or not a gain or loss is recognized for federal income tax purposes  8 investment income not directly related to the privilege exercised by a licensable business not classified as rendering financial services this exclusion shall apply to interest on bank accounts of the business and to interest dividends and other income derived from the investment of its own funds in securities and other types of investments unrelated to the licensed privilege this exclusion shall not apply to interest late fees and similar income attributable to an installment sale or other transaction that occurred in the regular course of business  9 receipts of a charitable nonprofit organization except to the extent the organization has receipts from an unrelated trade or business the income of which is taxable under internal revenue et seq for the purpose of this subsection the term charitable nonprofit organization shall mean an organization which is described in internal revenue c3 and to which contributions are deductible by the contributor under internal revenue except that educational institutions shall be limited to schools colleges and other similar institutions of learning  10 gifts contributions and membership dues of a nonprofit organization activities conducted for consideration which are similar to activities conducted for consideration by forprofit businesses shall be presumed to be activities that are part of a licensable business for the purpose of this subsection the term nonprofit organization shall mean an organization exempt from federal income tax under internal revenue other than charitable nonprofit organizations  11 sales in whole or in part made on credit which the business subsequently determines to be uncollectible which are or will be reported to the internal revenue service as a bad debt deduction for federal income tax purposes  provided that however the subsequent collection of a debt deducted from gross receipts as worthless is includable in gross receipts when received  12 membership dues collected by trade business professional public service or civic associations or other similar organizations provided that this exclusion the city charged in any manner with the duty of assessing or collecting license taxes have reason to believe in any case that the amount of actual or probable purchases or sales or the actual or probable commissions or the gross or net receipts from any business or profession or any other matters that may be pertinent to the assessment of such license tax have been incorrectly reported or returned or if such officer or employee has reason to believe that a person subject to this chapter has not obtained a business license such officer shall make a report thereof to the assessing official thereupon or in any case in which the assessing official shall deem it advisable he or she shall investigate and ascertain whether such person has made a correct return or has failed to make a required return to that end the assessing official is authorized and empowered to propound interrogatories to andor summons upon such person by registered letter to appear at the office of the assessing official at a time specified in such summons and to answer under oath questions touching upon such persons license tax liability further the assessing official is authorized to require of such person the production of all records books and papers related to the matter under investigation and is also authorized and empowered to make or cause to be made such other and further investigations examinations and audits of the records books and papers of such person in accordance with section 189 as the assessing official shall deem proper in order to accurately determine the proper return to be made by such person o179 111996 criminal penalties criminal penalties for violation of this chapter shall be as follows 1 conducting business without valid license any person who conducts a business trade occupation or profession without possessing a valid license obtained in accordance with the terms of this chapter shall be guilty of a class 1 misdemeanor each calendar day on which such person is in violation of this chapter shall constitute a separate offense 2 failure to remit tax any person who fails or refuses to remit any tax penalty or interest assessed under this chapter in a timely manner shall be guilty of a class 1 misdemeanor each calendar day on which such person is in violation of this chapter shall constitute a separate offense 3 failure to comply with summons answer questions or produce records any person who fails or refuses without good cause to answer a summons issued by the assessing official or designee or who fails or refuses to answer under oath questions relating to his or her tax liability pursuant to section 18211 or who fails or refuses to produce or allow to the assessing official access to records and statements touching on license tax liability shall be guilty of a class 3 misdemeanor each days refusal to furnish such access or information shall constitute a separate offense no person other than the taxpayer shall be convicted for failure to comply with a summons issued under the authority given in  5813110 of the virginia unless such failure was willful 4 willful collection of excess business license tax any motor vehicle dealer who collects from purchasers excess business license tax shall be guilty of a class 1 misdemeanor if such dealer knows that the amount separately stated as the amount of tax applicable to the sale is greater than actual tax liability each such instance of overcollection of tax shall constitute a separate offense 5 failure to comply with other requirements any person who fails or refuses to records of the locality shall be posted on the site where the disturbance is occurring and shall remain in effect until such time as permits and plan approvals are secured except in such situations iv in its entirety to read as herein set out formerly article iv pertained to similar subject matter and derived from o123 adopted  statutory authorization purpose and intent this article is adopted pursuant to the authority granted to localities by virginia 22280 the purpose of these provisions is to prevent the loss of life and property the creation of health and safety hazards the disruption of commerce and governmental services the extraordinary and unnecessary expenditure of public funds for flood protection and relief and the impairment of the tax base by 1 regulating uses activities and development which alone or in combination with other existing or future uses activities and development will cause unacceptable increases in flood heights velocities and frequencies  2 restricting or prohibiting certain uses activities and development from locating within districts subject to flooding  3 requiring all those uses activities and developments that do occur in floodprone districts to be protected andor floodproofed against flooding and flood damage  4 protecting individuals from buying land and structures which are unsuited for intended purposes because of flood hazards  and 5 acknowledgement that the tide data over the last 100 years clearly shows that chesapeake has been facing an escalating danger from both sea level rise and subsidence o083 71613  o142 102114 applicability these provisions shall apply to all privately and publicly owned lands within the jurisdiction of the city and identified as being floodprone o083 71613 definitions base flood or 100year flood means the flood having a one percent chance of being equaled or exceeded in any given year base flood elevation bfe means the federal emergency management agency fema designated 100year water surface elevation the water surface elevation of the base flood in relation to the datum specified on the communitys flood insurance rate map for the purposes of this article the 100year flood or one percent annual chance flood basement means any area of the building having its floor subgrade below ground level on all sides board means the local board of building code appeals community means the city of chesapeake unless otherwise indicated critical infrastructure fall within the following categories 1 governmental facilities essential for the delivery of critical services and crisis management including data and communication centers key government complexes and similar facilities as determined by the floodplain administrator 2 essential facilities those that are vital to health and welfare of entire populations including hospitals and other medical facilities retirement homes police and fire facilities emergency operations centers prisons evacuation shelters and schools and similar facilities as determined by the floodplain administrator 3 transportation systems those systems and the supporting infrastructure necessary for transport of people and resources including airports highways railways and waterways during major disasters including flood events up to the 500year flood 4 lifeline utility systems those vital to public health and safety including potable water wastewater oil natural gas electric power communication systems and similar facilities as determined by the floodplain administrator 5 high potential loss facilities failure or disruption of operations may have significant physical social environmental andor economic impact to neighboring communities including nuclear power plants highhazard dams urban levees and military installations 6 hazardous material facilities involved in the production storage andor transport of corrosives explosives flammable materials radioactive materials toxins and similar facilities as determined by the floodplain administrator development means any manmade change to improved or unimproved real estate including but not limited to buildings or other structures mining dredging filling grading paving excavation or drilling operations or storage of equipment or materials elevated building means a nonbasement building built to have the lowest floor elevated above the ground level by means of fill solid foundation perimeter walls pilings or columns posts and piers enclosed area means the enclosed walledin areas below the lowest floor of an elevated building encroachment means the advance or infringement of uses plant growth fill excavation buildings permanent structures or development into a floodplain which may impede or alter the flow capacity of a floodplain fill or filling means any depositing or stockpiling of earth materials to raise or alter the elevation of land flood or flooding means 1 a general or temporary condition of partial or complete inundation of normally dry land areas from a the overflow of inland or tidal waters  b the unusual and rapid accumulation or runoff of surface waters from any source  or c mudflows which are proximately caused by flooding as defined herein and are akin to a river of liquid and flowing mud on the surfaces of normally dry land areas as when earth is carried by a current of water and deposited along the path of the current 2 the collapse or subsistence of land along the shore of a lake or other body of water as a result of erosion or undermining caused by waves or currents of water exceeding anticipated cyclical levels or suddenly caused by an unusually high water level in a natural body of water accompanied by a severe storm or by an unanticipated force of nature such as flash flood or an abnormal tidal surge or by some similarly unusual and unforeseeable event which results in flooding flood insurance rate map firm means an official map of a community on which the administrator has delineated both the special hazard areas and the risk premium zones applicable to the community a firm that has been made available digitally is called a digital flood insurance rate map dfirm flood insurance study fis means an examination evaluation and determination of flood hazards and if appropriate corresponding water surface elevations or an examination evaluation and determination of mudflow andor floodrelated erosion hazards floodplain or floodprone area means any land area susceptible to being inundated by water from any source flood proofing means any combination of structural and nonstructural additions changes or adjustments to structures which reduce or eliminate flood damage to real estate or improved real property water and sanitary facilities structures and their contents freeboard means a factor of safety usually expressed in feet above a flood level for purposes of floodplain management freeboard tends to compensate for the many unknown factors that could contribute to flood heights greater than the height calculated for a selected size flood and floodway conditions such as wave action bridge openings and the hydrological effect of urbanization in the watershed highest adjacent grade means the highest natural elevation of the ground surface prior to construction next to the proposed walls of a structure historic structure means any structure that is 1 listed individually in the national register of historic places a listing maintained by the department of interior or preliminarily determined by the secretary of the interior as meeting the requirements for individual listing on the national register  2 certified or preliminarily determined by the secretary of the interior as contributing to the historical significance of a registered historic district or a district
